Council Member Wills moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 28, 2012 be adopted as printed by Council Member Chin.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Chin moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 28, 2012 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 18-A, in relation to establishing a prevailing wage requirement for building service employees in city leased or financially assisted facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. No. 18-A - Establishing a prevailing wage requirement for building service employees in city leased or financially assisted facilities.

Items.MatterName: Michael M. McSweeney, re-appointment by the Council as City Clerk and Clerk of the Council.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Jackson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226 (g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 247 Dyckman Street, Borough of Manhattan, Committee Board no. 12, Application 20125338 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 247 Dyckman St, Manhattan (20125338 TCM)

Resolutions

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an electric vehicle advisory committee.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Electric vehicle charging stand pilot program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regulating sidewalk electric vehicle charging stands as revocable consents.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Regulating sidewalk electric vehicle charging stands as revocable consents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that all hotels in the city of New York provide their housekeeping staff with silent alarms for their protection.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all hotels in NYC provide their housekeeping staff with silent alarms for their protection.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact and the Governor to sign A. 7707A-2011 and S. 6431-2011, which would prohibit the possession, sale, offer for sale, trade, or distribution of shark fins.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Prohibit the possession, sale, offer for sale, trade, or distribution of shark fins. (A.7707A/ S.6431)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing owners of landmarked properties to use the same or similar materials in maintenance of their property .
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Allowing owners of landmarked properties to use the same or similar materials in maintenance of their property .

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to additional guidelines and procedures to the designation process for a landmark, interior landmark, scenic landmark and historic district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Additional guidelines and procedures to the designation process for a landmark, interior landmark, scenic landmark and historic district.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a transfer of jurisdiction over Hart Island from the department of corrections to the department of parks and recreation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Transfer of jurisdiction over Hart Island from the department of corrections to the department of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report incidents of assaults on municipal employees on the department’s website.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to report incidents of assaults on municipal employees on the department’s website.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would amend the Real Property Tax Law to allow owners of not-for-profit organizations to submit documentation other than the application prepared and mailed to such owner by the Department of Finance to prove such organizations are entitled to a property tax exemption.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Allow owners of not-for-profit organizations to submit documentation other than the application prepared and mailed to such owner by the Department of Finance to prove such organizations are entitled to a property tax exemption.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to enact and the President to sign S.1872/H.R.3423, the Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Act of 2011, which amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for the tax treatment of ABLE accounts established under State programs for the care of family members with disabilities, and for other purposes.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Congress to enact and the President to sign S.1872/H.R.3423, the Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Act of 2011.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the landmarks preservation commission to create a timeline for the designation process.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Requiring the landmarks preservation commission to create a timeline for the designation process.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the landmarks preservation commission to allow denied requests for evaluation to be nominated to the landmarks preservation commission entire body for a vote.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Requiring the landmarks preservation commission to allow denied requests for evaluation to be nominated to the landmarks preservation commission entire body for a vote.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to waiving parks permit fees for schools and child day care centers and providing an online system for school permit applications.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Waiving parks permit fees for schools and child day care centers and providing an online system for school permit applications.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education’s Office of School Food to increase the health of food options in school lunches and breakfasts by implementing the recommendations of the Brooklyn Food Coalition’s “Roadmap for Healthy, Sustainable School Food.”
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Implementing the recommendations of the Brooklyn Food Coalition’s “Roadmap for Healthy, Sustainable School Food.”

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing car washes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Licensing car washes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.9664/S.6493, legislation to ease the burden on licensed home care service agencies, certified home health agencies and consumer directed personal assisted programs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Ease the burden on licensed home care service agencies, certified home health agencies and consumer directed personal assisted programs. (A.9664/S.6493)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Senate and State Assembly to pass and the Governor to sign S.4098/A.6275, which would provide that persons living with clinical/symptomatic HIV or AIDS who are receiving shelter assistance or an emergency shelter allowance shall not be required to pay more than 30% of household income towards shelter costs, including rent and utilities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Provide that persons living with clinical/symptomatic HIV or AIDS who are receiving shelter assistance or an emergency shelter allowance shall not be required to pay more than 30% of household income towards shelter costs, including rent and utilities. (S

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the reuse or recycling of discarded carpeting from commercial units or buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Reuse or recycling of discarded carpeting from commercial units or buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would require the New York Public Library, the Brooklyn Public Library, and the Queens Borough Public Library to install surveillance cameras in all designated children’s sections.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Require the NY Public Library, the Brooklyn Public Library, and the Queens Borough Public Library to install surveillance cameras in all designated children’s sections.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass and the Governor to sign into law S.5260-C/A.7251-C, which would amend the Penal Law to establish the offense of fraudulent prescription, dispensing and procurement of non-controlled substance prescription medications and devices, and the offense of unlawful possession of non-controlled substance prescription medications and devices.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Establish the offense of fraudulent prescription, dispensing and procurement of non-controlled substance prescription medications and devices. (S.5260-C/A.7251-C)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of S.2000, which would amend the Criminal Procedure Law in order to limit plea bargains for individuals charged with a sex offense felony or a specified felony offense, and calling on the Assembly to pass a companion bill, and on the Governor to sign such legislation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Amend the Criminal Procedure Law in order to limit plea bargains for individuals charged with a sex offense felony or a specified felony offense, and calling on the Assembly to pass a companion bill, and on the Governor to sign such legislation. (S.2000)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of A.9148/S.6413, which would raise the state minimum wage, and calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign this legislation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Raise the state minimum wage. (A.9148/S.6413)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature and the Governor to amend the New York State Penal Law by increasing penalties for the unintentional discharge of a firearm resulting in an injury to an individual.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Increasing penalties for the unintentional discharge of a firearm resulting in an injury to an individual.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Senate and the New York State Assembly to pass and the Governor to sign A.4672B and S.641B, which would enhance the criminal penalties for assaulting an employee of a local social services district or juvenile detention agency while such employee is in the performance of his or her duties.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Enhance the criminal penalties for assaulting an employee of a local social services district or juvenile detention agency while such employee is in the performance of his or her duties. (A.4672B and S.641B)

N 120132 ZRY by the Department of City Planning, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York that would remove Zoning impediments to green building features that will help promote energy efficient building envelopes; renewable energy, stormwater detention, reduction of carbon emissions and provide for a healthier New York City.
